summary: What a fun day it is today
title: What a fun day it is today
body:
(9/13/18) The Pokémon marathon on Twitch is now LIVE!

The next 10 episodes that is going to be streamed (from Season 3 The Johto Journeys) will feature the return of the Squirtle Squad, Ash & Misty’s Totodile competition, a different colored Noctowl? Oh and my personal favorite, the Ursaring episode where everyone gets mixed up with one another xD And much much more to show in today’s rotation!

The episode set will rerun in multiple times today just so you won’t miss the stream depending on your schedule…BUT THAT’S NOT ALL!

At 3pm PDT / 6pm EDT, a Nintendo Direct broadcast will be streamed on Twitch as well! It will last approximately 35 minutes, and will feature information about upcoming Nintendo Switch and 3DS titles!

Watching with Twitch chat could be the best (or worst) experience you’ll ever have! But if you want a more comfy chat experience, feel free to talk/chat about the marathon in my Pokémon Discord server PokéTōku —> Invite link here :)

Redbubble || Commission Info

❤︎✧~Welcome to Kei's Den~✧❤︎

Kei-kun/Landon/personal/positive space blog.

  • Hobbyist artist.
  • Nerd.
  • Cat dad.
  • Multi-fandom.
  • Mostly reblogs.
  • Panromantic grey-ace.
  • Single, not looking.
  • Trans man.
  • 💉 since March 26th, 2019.
  • 🔪 ???
  • He/him or they/them.
  • Egalitarian.

    • Here if anyone would like to talk, but please stay respectful and friendly.

    I tag my posts and reblogs as needed, but also talk in my tags so if that sort of thing annoys you steer clear. Beware my #nsfw tag.

    I also sometimes give advice if asked for it, and will do the odd blog promo if you ask me nicely and I feel like helping out ;D It helps if we're already friends, too~ uwu

    Follow for follow unless hardcore NSFW material is involved.

    I track the tag #keisden

tags: OOF naming has never been a strong suit of mine
for those people out there looking to improve keep at it
drawing what you love regularly will automatically improve
and using refrences and practicing things outside your comfort zone can only make you stronger
I still have a lot of room to improve in character design
summary: @lexytheflareon’s art inspired me to dig up my old pokesona and redesign them for kicks. I remember being pretty happy when I...
caption:
@lexytheflareon’s art inspired me to dig up my old pokesona and redesign them for kicks. I remember being pretty happy when I designed her originally but it’s amazing how 7 years can change what you value in your art.

November 2011 drawing

reblog.comment:
@lexytheflareon’s art inspired me to dig up my old pokesona and redesign them for kicks. I remember being pretty happy when I designed her originally but it’s amazing how 7 years can change what you value in your art.

November 2011 drawing

tags: if you're gonna bring up i choose you I have to say I didn't like how they showed crying scene
sun & moon however has made me appreciate the scenes
I will be fully devastated in a year when the series ends and we head to gen 8
...and yes I m may have just rewatched the episode again
summary: Another reason to love Sun & Moon:[[MORE]] It actually allows us to see Satoshi like, look like he’s breaking. He’s crying. He’s...
body:
Another reason to love Sun & Moon:

It actually allows us to see Satoshi like, look like he’s breaking. He’s crying. He’s trying to hold it in. But he’s crying. This is by the most emotional Satoshi I’ve ever seen, like I actually feel the emotion from the animation alone. We see tears. We hear the voice breaking.

Like…. that lip movement. It’s so well done. The eyes. Everything in that scene is so well done.

I honestly don’t like how they did the cry scene in I Choose You, like it just didn’t look right to me. Highly prefer the original way of subtly showing Satoshi’s tears and trying to be strong. And Sun & Moon does it the way I like it. ♥

I’ve certainly said this before, but to repeat myself: For me, job’s well done when animation alone manages to deliver the feels. Sun & Moon has done it so freaking many times now. I think i can say at 100′% certainty Sun & Moon will always be my favourite series. It’s what brought me to the series as a whole, it’s what has made me feel so much emotions, and it has certainly been the series that has made me love Pokemon ten times more. And has allowed me to meet so many god damn good people in the fandom. Bless Sun & Moon, bless my friends, bless Bebenom, bless Satoshi golden boy, bless Alola.

I honestly don’t like how they did the cry scene in I Choose You, like it just didn’t look right to me. Highly prefer the original way of subtly showing Satoshi’s tears and trying to be strong. And Sun & Moon does it the way I like it. ♥

Another reason to love Sun & Moon:

It actually allows us to see Satoshi like, look like he’s breaking. He’s crying. He’s trying to hold it in. But he’s crying. This is by the most emotional Satoshi I’ve ever seen, like I actually feel the emotion from the animation alone. We see tears. We hear the voice breaking.

Like…. that lip movement. It’s so well done. The eyes. Everything in that scene is so well done.

I honestly don’t like how they did the cry scene in I Choose You, like it just didn’t look right to me. Highly prefer the original way of subtly showing Satoshi’s tears and trying to be strong. And Sun & Moon does it the way I like it. ♥

I’ve certainly said this before, but to repeat myself: For me, job’s well done when animation alone manages to deliver the feels. Sun & Moon has done it so freaking many times now. I think i can say at 100′% certainty Sun & Moon will always be my favourite series. It’s what brought me to the series as a whole, it’s what has made me feel so much emotions, and it has certainly been the series that has made me love Pokemon ten times more. And has allowed me to meet so many god damn good people in the fandom. Bless Sun & Moon, bless my friends, bless Bebenom, bless Satoshi golden boy, bless Alola.
